attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Second EU referendum after a suggested "cool down" period of 2 months.
attributes.background: 23rd of June saw the United Kingdom EU referendum. Campaigning on both sides was not comprehensive enough for informed decisions to be made creating a failed democratic result with consequences only being realised after the1st referendum. A second, more informed, truthful referendum is required
attributes.additional_details: There have now been a number of revelations made by prominent Leave campaigners after the referendum has completed that what they said during the build up to the referendum was untrue. Democracy only functions when the populous has factually correct information in which to base their decisions - in the first referendum, this unfortunately was not the case. If a 2nd referendum is held and results are within 5% of each other, the decision should be given to the UK government to vote upon.

attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: The government should rerun the referendum on our membership of the EU.
attributes.background: The binary question of leave or remain should have a third choice: Remain as a member with reforms met within a specified deadline. If the deadline is not met then we leave.

attributes.action: Call another EU referendum for those aged 16-30
attributes.background: What should have been done previously and what should be addressed now, is the importance of the generation whom the EU referendum would effect. Therefore it is my request that as a generation, we should be given the choice, rather than our elders making that choice for us.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Count non-voters as a vote for the status quo in referendums.
attributes.background: People who vote do so to express their choice.  By not voting, people are saying they are not really concerned either way.  If they held a strong conviction they would have voted.  Change should not be imposed without taking these non-voters into account.
attributes.additional_details:
The in-out EU referendum is a case in point. Fewer than half the voting public voted for change but change will happen because insufficient people voted for the status quo.

Non-voters who weren't really concerned, or who didn't vote because they thought the status quo would win, should have their 'vote' counted.

To make a significant change (eg leaving the EU) more than half of the voting public should vote for it, ie not half of the voters.

attributes.action: Allow 15,16 and 17 year olds to vote in a second referendum.
attributes.background: The generation of people who were not allowed to vote will be the ones who are most affected by the change. Therefore they should be allowed a say in their future by having a vote in a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of 18-24 year olds voted remain, this shows that the young people of our population want to stay and should be given a chance to make this happen.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Give greater autonomy to Northern England and create a Northern Assembly
attributes.background: The North of England is a diverse and great place and deserves to have the same say about its own laws and futures as places such as Wales and Scotland.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its £534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: Ensure that in future, qualifying persons are automatically registered to vote.
attributes.background:
To vote in a UK election a person must be "registered to vote" and also: 18 or over, be a British citizen, a qualifying Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of the Republic of Ireland.

The requirement to register should be dropped so that those meeting criteria are automatically able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/electoral-register

attributes.action: Put more pressure on people and other countries to cut global warming
attributes.background: I understand that the government is already trying to cut down global warming but I still don't believe everything is being done. The purpose of a government is to better our future by learning from what has gone wrong. Flooding will increase with global warming, as will the cost of flood repairs..
attributes.additional_details: Sea levels are set to rise by twice as much as anticipated by the end of this century, showing that we are not prepared for the extent of the problems that this on going issue will create. The record for the lowest area of ice coverage in the Arctic is set to happen either this year or next year which creates yet another issue for our wildlife, which has been ignored because we rank the life of an endangered animal that doesn't contribute to pollution lower than our own.

attributes.action: Ban leashing dogs by their collar, in favour of front-chest harnesses
attributes.background:
Being leashed by the neck puts pressure and damage on:

- the trachea (windpipe)
- the spinal cord 
- the vertebral discs, 
- the oesophagus (gullet)

Harnesses offer better safety and comfort, alleviating pressure on the neck and also allowing the owner to better pull the dog from harms way.
attributes.additional_details: "I have observed the relationships between the neck injuries and health of dogs, and learned that if the flow of energy in the neck is interrupted or restricted, a whole array of problems may arise, including lameness, skin issues, allergies, lung and heart problems, digestive issues, ear and eye conditions and thyroid gland dysfunctions. I also suspect that the patients who have severe energy flow congestion in the neck area have higher cancer rates" - Dr. Peter Dobias, Holistic Veterinarian.

attributes.action: Support Hindu Community Temple of Threat of Closure Retaining Spiritual Heritage
attributes.background:
We the undersigned object to the closure of the VRAJDHAM  HAVELI (TEMPLE) Leicester, as a consequence of the Priest not being able to perform religious duties.

We call upon the Home Office to reinstate VSUK's sponsorship license immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a heartfelt appeal to stop violation of our Hindu religious freedom and abuse of racial tolerance.

Without this reinstatement the significance would be:
 
A) The Vrajdham Haveli (Temple) will be forced to close down
B) The deity (Lord Krishna) will have to return back to India
C) An irrecoverable loss to the Hindu community, culture, sentiment and beliefs
D) A destruction of a thriving national community centre

attributes.action: Impose legislation to allow online cancellation of services bought online
attributes.background: Many services such as insurance, credit record services and music streaming can be bought online, 24 hours a day. However in most cases customers are required to telephone between certain hours on certain days & speak to a salesperson who will try to convince the customer to stay.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is limiting choice & costing the public money when they are forced to continue paying for a service they no longer require because companies make the process deliberately difficult to protect their profit.

We request the government impose a legal requirement on all services that provide on-line signup to also provide an easy on-line cancellation process with the same availability without unreasonable limitations.

attributes.action: Ensure that children's safeguarding be monitored by specific named professionals
attributes.background: The Woods LSCB review states that challenge by the LSCB is vital, but the government response to the review gives responsibility to public bodies with no named professional to offer challenge or monitor change. Revised LSCB terms of reference could provide this and safeguard vulnerable children.
attributes.additional_details: The best performing LSCBs are those with strong chairs that provide robust challenge and monitor improvement. The government response to this review is to remove the statutory strength that permits this challenge. This government has a duty to ensure that its duties are wholly taken over by a named role/team within or independent of these agencies and safeguard vulnerable children, a team already existent in current LSCBs that could be strengthened by revised terms of reference.

attributes.action: Ban being able to own, and have a cockerel in an urban area, they are loud.
attributes.background: I have an inconsiderate neighbour, who will not put a collar on their cockerel to reduce the noise of the crow, the cockerel cannot help it, that's the way God made it, but us humans need to keep the animals in the country and out of urban area.

attributes.action: More Gender Identity Clinics. Train up doctors and use local practices.
attributes.background: We need more Gender Identity Clinics and more trained doctors so that all Trans patients get quicker service. The longer the waiting time, the more suicides we'll see...

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation Public Transport and British Business
attributes.background: All Business and Transport should be handed back to the Government including Great Western Railways as Trains including buses will be cheaper for the public to buy tickets. Also British Gas and other Business which were owned by the government to be re instated also to reduce Air Passenger Tax....
attributes.additional_details: On Long haul Flights.

attributes.action: Overseas military action to require super majority vote of two third of MP’s
attributes.background: The Petition's purpose is to ensure a higher percentage of the electorate’s views are taken account of when Parliament considers military action and that only Parliament can authorize the deployment of UK military forces as non-combative advisers in overseas conflicts to which the UK is not party.
attributes.additional_details:
A Parliamentary Motion for armed conflict is perhaps the most significant matter that our MPs’ are ever required to vote upon and as in the case of Iraq and subsequent conflicts their vote has had enormous repercussions for the United Kingdom, not only in terms of  those killed and wounded but in the aftermath, as now seen in Iraq, Afghanistan and Libya.

The present majority government received less than 37% of the vote from just 24% of the electorate at the 2015 General Election.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: To lower the legal driving age to16 in the UK
attributes.background: I would like to lower the legal driving age to 16 as at this age you can take on many adult responsibilities such as paying tax, join the army, leave home, pay adult tickets on public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Australian process of learning to drive is three fold where learners are required to log their driving experience throughout the learning. Young adults must display the relevant 'P' plates to show the stages of learning they are at such as Red P plates to green P plates to full license.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Stop HS2
attributes.background: Stop HS2 destroying our green belt and countryside

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Equality and fairness : Child Benefit system
attributes.background: Separated parents (with parental responsibility) that have shared custody of their children should be allowed to have an equal share in the benefits received for the children; the current system only allows one person to claim for child benefit.

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Increase digital government funding and introduce online voting
attributes.background:
- Increase funding of GovUK development
- Introduce citizens' and residents' online certificates for online voting and online conclusion of contracts
attributes.additional_details:
Gov.uk website is a robust but limited online application which is created to simplify life for interacting with government. This petition is aiming to state the importance to increase funding of more rapid development of digital services of the government.
Other ideas to discuss:
- Introduce digital citizenship (see Estonia)
- Introduce emails for all citizens where all communication lands
This may help to make UK more competitive.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: removal of traffic commissioners powers to suspend, revoke driving licences
attributes.background: when you get an offence like an TS10 and after you have paid the fixed penalty and received the points, you are called up to the traffic commissioner nearly 3 years after the fact and she decides to suspend your licence while under a high court ruling this can only happen for a maximum of 21 days.
attributes.additional_details: the traffic  has suspended licences for 22 years according to DVLA they have had letters from VOSA through the traffic commissioner to suspend a licence until the holder is 70 years of age under current law this can only be done for a maximum of 21 day through a high court ruling or 12 month through the totting up of more that 12 penalty points

attributes.action: To change the education system to ensure all students benefit
attributes.background:
What needs to be done: 
-	The amount of memorization needed to do well in the subject needs to be reduced.
-	Courses should focus more on coursework due to the stress of exams.
-	The core subjects need to be changed in order to benefit the child outside of qualification.
attributes.additional_details:
A focus on memorization leads to a bias towards students who have a good memory, but not necessarily a good understanding. The amount of information needed to memorise has recently been increased by Ofqual.

Coursework has recently been removed completely from all non-practical subjects. This increases stress drastically to the point where it may have physical effects. Many students also struggle to perform under stressful conditions which means they do not get results that reflect their ability.

attributes.action: Prevent reverse charging on mobile phone contracts unless consent is given first
attributes.background: The current laws allow anyone with your mobile number, who sets up a business through the regulator, to charge you too "Receive" texts that cost you money without your consent.  Some of these are on the proviso that you opt-out of something you haven't even requested.
attributes.additional_details:
It should not be possible to charge you to receive texts until the user has opted-in, by responding to a text message instead of just receiving it, and mobile network operators should be forced to disable reverse charge billing if requested by the bill payer.

Mobile network operators should also be made to publish their involvement in these companies as well as the profits that they make from them as there is clearly a conflict of interest.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough
